New Records: Corey Seager hit the hardest-hit Fall Classic homer in the Statcast era, dating back to 2015, with a ball leaving his bat at 114.5 mph.
Key Match Events: Corey Seager launched a two-run homer and made a slick defensive play in the eighth inning to start a crucial double play.
Max Scherzer combined with four relievers for a gem on the mound.
Adolis García cut down Christian Walker at the plate with a stellar throw from right field in the second inning.
Jon Gray, Josh Sborz, Aroldis Chapman, and José Leclerc combined to keep Arizona’s offense quiet most of the evening.
Geraldo Perdomo followed with an RBI single in the eighth inning, making it 3-1.
Chapman worked out of a jam in the eighth inning by striking out Corbin Carroll before Seager started a clutch double play.
Marcus Semien’s two-out single into left center made it 1-0 in the third inning.
Corey Seager smashed a no-doubt homer deep into the right-field seats in the third inning.
Josh Jung made a strong throw across the diamond to beat Alek Thomas after a deflected grounder.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Texas Rangers are 9-0 this postseason when scoring first.
The two teams combined for no errors over the first two games of the series.
Adolis García is a Gold Glove finalist who has one of the best arms in the big leagues.
